required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of a Protocol of Specific Activation.
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of a Protocol of Specific Activation of Mide Glute and Core in the Stability of Knee in Football Players: A Single-Blind Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
In football, knee is the joint that suffers the most severe injuries. Sometimes, this is produced by poor pre-activation of the musculature that is responsible for knee stability and central stability.
OBJETIVE: Study the efficacy of specific gluteus medius and core activation protocol in knee stability in youth football players.

detailed_description.textblock: A randomized, longitudinal clinical trial with a blinded and prospective evaluator will be carried out, in which the knee stability will be evaluated with the following tests: Y-balance test and Flamingo balance test. The measurements will be made before and after the intervention. The study will be carried out with patients evaluated by a specialist in Traumatology and will be randomly divided by a system of numerical tables through a computer program between the experimental and control groups. The control group will perform a typical warm-up of competitive football; and the experimental one will do this above, added to a specific activation of gluteus medius and core. Dynamic stability (Y-balance test) and postural and static stability (Flamingo balance test) will be measured before and after the intervention.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A specialist physician will be diagnosed the process.

primary_outcome.description: Y-balance test Measures the strength of the lower limb, neuromuscular control, flexibility and dynamic balance

secondary_outcome.description: Y-balance test Measures the strength of the lower limb, neuromuscular control, flexibility and dynamic balance.
Flamingo balance test measures postural balance and static balance.

arm_group.description: The control group will perform a typical warm-up of competitive football, added to a specific activation of gluteus medius and core.
The control group will perform a typical warm-up of competitive football.

intervention.description: Experimental group will perform a typical warm-up of competitive football, added to a specific activation of gluteus medius and core.
Control group will perform a typical warm-up of competitive football

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Perform soccer sports practice, at least 3 times a week at a competitive level.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a knee surgery.
- Patients who are injured at the time of the study.
